Description: Lower wall and stem of foot of Attic pottery amphoriskos; decorated with net pattern; lowest parts reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Compare Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology, NA252.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 111 no. 394 pl. 82)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1962)
